messages.title: 5 MORE YEARS OF GORDON BROWN OR CHANGE WITH THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: In just a few weeks we will have the most important election for a generation. Our economy is burdened by huge debts and homes are out of work. Our society is broken by crime and irresponsible behaviour. Our political system is in a mess. We can't go on like this. A Conservative government will take hold action on all fronts. We'll cut Gordon Brown's waste and debt to get our economy moving. We'll support families and back people who work hard, pay their taxes and play by the rules. We'll raise standards in our schools so our children get the education they deserve. We'll mend our broken society by scrapping the perks and cutting the cost of Parliament. Most importantly, we'll take power away from the political elite and give you more control over your life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour are now the party of unemployment. Conservatives believe strongly in work, personal responsibility, enterprise, and giving tax breaks to help people off welfare and into work.

David Cameron has made the NHS his number one priority. He and the Conservative party will improve it for everyone, promising that any gains made by the party will mean improvements for the NHS every year.

Creating a new generation of schools run by teachers and responsible to parents, not micromanaged by politicians. Greater choice and smaller schools with smaller classes will raise standards and restore confidence in the curriculum.

Families are the foundation of a strong society. Conservative plans include Sure Start with 4,200 extra health visitors, flexible working, improved maternity and paternity leave, and making Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe.

issues.economy: We'll cut Gordon Brown's waste and debt to get our economy moving.
issues.education: We'll raise standards in our schools so our children get the education they deserve.
issues.governance: We'll mend our broken society by scrapping the perks and cutting the cost of Parliament.
issues.health: David Cameron has made the NHS his number one priority. He and the Conservative party will improve it for everyone.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour are now the party of unemployment. Conservatives believe in giving tax breaks to help people off welfare and into work.

quotes.text: So that's the choice at this election: five more years of Gordon Brown's tired government making things worse or change this country needs with the Conservatives.

images.caption: David Cameron interacting with diverse groups of people.
